References

In the previous sections, you may have wondered how Euclase resolves variable references. In other words, when a cell says x, how does Euclase search for x?

Euclase resolves variable references by traversing its object hierarchy, the hierarchy that's created through objects and sub-objects.

Euclase also has a few built-in variable names, described below:

  • this: Represents the current object
  • parent: Represents the current object's parent
  • root: Represents the root

Try renaming OBJ.x and see what happens to the value of a. Then, create a new property of OBJ named d that references the outer x.

Objects States
